description.en:
The course provides an overview of the basics of networking (Internet protocols, routing, main network devices) and Internet Governance (RFC, IETF, ISOC, ICANN); basics of computer architecture, backbone and carrier infrastructure; contemporary uses of ICTs (e-everything); trends in developments and applications of ICTs (distributed systems, utility computing, mobile markets).
The course also explains the main stages of IT project development (requirement analysis, design, implementation, testing, and deployment).
description.et:
Aine annab ülevaate domeenist kui sellisest, alates elektromagneetilisest spektrist kuni interneti arhitektuuri ja mobiilsete turgude taristuni. Luuakse alusteadmised arvutitest, võrgust, koodist, veebilehtede ülesehitusest, domeeninimede süsteemist jne. Omandatakse oskus kasutada IKT valdkonna põhisõnavara. Samuti käsitletakse IKT kaasaegseid rakendusi, arengutrende ning peamisi vaidlus- ja konfliktteemasid nii riikide kui kasutajagruppide tasandil.
Ka annab kursus baasülevaate IT projekti peamistest etappidest (nõuete analüüs, disain, rakendamise, testimine ja kasutuselevõtt).

objectives.en: To provide a systematic and comprehensive understanding of the fundamental aspects of information technology, the basics of computers and computer networks and the application of those in business and their impact on the societal processes.
objectives.et: Anda süsteemsed ja põhjalikud baasteadmised IT valdkonnast, arvutite ja arvutivõrkude ülesehitusest, nende rakendusest äris ja mõjust ühiskondlikele protsessidele.

learning_outcomes.en: After passing this course the student will be familiar with:
*	the main elements and concepts of information technology,
*	the basic building blocs of computers and networks and
*	the application of information technology in business and society.

independent_work.et:
1. Online Test - 1:

This test will assess your understanding of the materials covered in the Information Systems, Hardware and Software sections.

Format: The test will be conducted in the Moodle environment and will allow open materials. It includes multiple-choice questions and short-answer questions.

Submission Deadline: October 6, 2024 (23:59).


2. Online test - 2:

This test will assess your understanding of the materials covered in the Network & Data, IT & Law Intersection, and AI & Information Society sections.

Format: The test will be conducted in the Moodle environment and will allow open materials. It includes multiple-choice questions and short-answer questions.

Submission Deadline: November 3, 2024 (23:59).


3. Essay Assignment

Topic: The specific topic will be announced during Week 1 of the course.

Length: The essay should be between 5000-6000 characters, including spaces.

Submission Details:
The essay must be uploaded to Moodle by the deadline.
The filename should include your name (e.g., JohnDoe_Essay.docx).
The header of the document must also include your name.

Deadline:
November 10, 2024 (23:59)

4. Technology case presentation (group work)

Each group is required to analyze and present a technology covered in the course. 

The analysis should include:
Technical Feasibility: A brief overview of the technology's technical viability and implementation.
Problem Solved: An explanation of the specific problem the technology addresses and how it provides a solution.
Ensure that your presentation effectively communicates these aspects to demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of the selected technology.

Assignment deadlines:
Report and video submission - November 17, 2024 (23:59).
Live session (presentation) - November 23, 2024 (10:15 - 13:30).

description.et:
Online Test - 1:

Total Points: 15
Multiple-choice questions: 9 points
Short-answer questions: 6 points
Passing Requirements: to pass the test, you must score at least 7 points and submit your answers before the deadline.
You will have 3 attempts, with no time limits between each attempt. The highest score from your attempts will be recorded.

Online test - 2:

Total Points: 15
Multiple-choice questions: 9 points
Short-answer questions: 6 points
Passing Requirements: to pass the test, you must score at least 7 points and submit your answers before the deadline.
You will have 3 attempts, with no time limits between each attempt. The highest score from your attempts will be recorded.

The essay will be evaluated based on the following criteria, with a total of 50 points available:

Structure Compliance: 10 points
Ensure that your essay follows a clear and logical structure as outlined in the course guidelines.

Grammar and Formatting: 10 points
Adhere to proper grammar rules and follow the formatting requirements provided in the course outline.

Logical Structure and Argumentation: 10 points
Your essay should present a coherent and persuasive argument supported by evidence and clear reasoning.

Level of Analysis: 20 points
Demonstrate a deep and thoughtful analysis of the topic, exploring it from multiple angles and providing insights.

Group work

Total Points: Maximum of 20 points

Level of Analysis in the Report: 10 points
All group members receive the same score based on the depth and quality of the analysis presented.

Video Presentation: 5 points
All group members receive the same score for the video presentation's clarity, engagement, and effectiveness.

Participation in the Live Session: 5 points
Individual points are awarded only to students who actively participate and present during the live session.

6. Earn at Least 51 Points by the End of the Course.

description.et:
Fundamentals of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) and information systems.
Key components of ICT, including technological frameworks and modeling technologies.
Economic impact of ICT, focusing on its role as a growth driver and its influence on global connectivity.
Challenges related to ICT, such as cybersecurity and the digital divide.

Basic logic and software layers;
Software production: process, business models, best practices and current trends;

IT & Law intersection

Digital Maturity Model: Tool for assessing and guiding digital transformation with five core dimensions and detailed criteria.
Core Business Dimensions: Customer Strategy, Technology, Operations, Organization, and Culture.
Challenges in Digital Transformation: Lack of industry-specific roadmaps and slow automation progress.
Statistics on IT Project Success: High failure rates of IT projects and their economic impact.
Governance and Project Management: Need for effective governance and alignment with organizational strategy.
